intro: Eunomia montbretii, commonly known as the Montbret's bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded locations. Eunomia montbretii is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
